DataElement.preferredName: Pegaspargase Discontinue Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes no response to a question asking if Pegaspargase administration was discontinued.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A complex of polyethylene glycol conjugated with L-asparaginase.  Asparaginase hydrolyzes L-asparagine to L-aspartic acid and ammonia, thereby depleting these cells of asparagine and blocking protein synthesis and tumor cell proliferation, especially in the G1 phase of the cell cycle.  The agent also induces apoptosis in tumor cells. Pegylation decreases the enzyme's antigenicity. Asparagine is critical to protein synthesis in leukemic cells, which cannot synthesize this amino acid due to the absence of the enzyme asparagine synthase. (NCI04)_To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A complex of polyethylene glycol conjugated with L-asparaginase. The agent also induces apoptosis in tumor cells. Pegylation decreases the enzyme's antigenicity. Asparagine is critical to protein synthesis in leukemic cells, which cannot synthesize this amino acid due to the absence of the enzyme asparagine synthase. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: A complex of polyethylene glycol conjugated with L-asparaginase.  Asparaginase hydrolyzes L-asparagine to L-aspartic acid and ammonia, thereby depleting these cells of asparagine and blocking protein synthesis and tumor cell proliferation, especially in the G1 phase of the cell cycle.  The agent also induces apoptosis in tumor cells. Pegylation decreases the enzyme's antigenicity. Asparagine is critical to protein synthesis in leukemic cells, which cannot synthesize this amino acid due to the absence of the enzyme asparagine synthase. (NCI04)
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was Pegaspargase discontinued
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was Pegaspargase discontinued during this reporting period OR a previous reporting period in which Pegaspargase was prescribed but not administered?
